result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwann Lavell McBride was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antwann Lavell McBride

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED
Defendant plead GUILTY. Court found the defendant guilty. 

The court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $50.00 including all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges by 5/13/2016 or a civil judgment will be entered.

Defendant Antwann Lavell McBride in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 1 amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Milwaukee County Ordinance 63.01, a Civil Forfeiture.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense counsel unable to contact client. Due to reasons placed on the record, Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Court ordered Jury Trial date of 4/13/2016 be converted to a Status of Counsel date. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw. Case set for Motion to Withdraw of counsel on 4/5/2016 at 8:30 am. Parties notified.
Received and Filed, Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant Antwann Lavell McBride in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. Defense received new discovery. Defense requests an adjourned Jury Trial date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Jury trial scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antwann Lavell McBride in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Final Pretrial held. State to keep offer open until Jury Trial date. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 2/8/2016 at 8:30 am. Case adjourned to branch 24.

Defendant Antwann Lavell McBride in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial.  Defense would like an adjournment of the jury trial is counsel has just learned of a new defense and needs to investigate.  State put their offer on the record.  Court vacated the 12/16/15 jury trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 24.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antwann Lavell McBride in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antwann Lavell McBride in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Counsel informed Court there is a conflict.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.   Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antwann Lavell McBride in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State notified court this case should be tabbed a domestice violence case. Court ordered case reassigned to branch 40, Judge Dallet.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 40.
  Status conference scheduled for 10-05-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antwann Lavell McBride in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense received discovery. No offer made at this time.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (7/1/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Antwann Lavell McBride
Current: 4548 North 76th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 06-30-2015)
Prior: 4548 North 76th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lashinna W., Christopher J. and Jimmy W. or their residence or place of employment

Defendant Antwann Lavell McBride in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 06-30-2015 at 01:30pm
